sn54.5:1.1: “Mendicants, when mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated it’s very fruitful and beneficial.
sn54.5:1.2: And how is mindfulness of breathing developed and cultivated to be very fruitful and beneficial?
sn54.5:1.3: It’s when a mendicant has gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut. They sit down cross-legged, with their body straight, and establish mindfulness right there.
sn54.5:1.4: Just mindful, they breathe in. Mindful, they breathe out. …
sn54.5:1.5: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in observing letting go.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out observing letting go.’
sn54.5:1.6: Mindfulness of breathing, when developed and cultivated in this way, is very fruitful and beneficial.
sn54.5:2.1: When mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated in this way you can expect seven fruits and benefits.
sn54.5:2.3: You attain enlightenment early on in this very life.
sn54.5:2.5: If not, you attain enlightenment at the time of death.
sn54.5:2.7: If not, with the ending of the five lower fetters you’re extinguished in between one life and the next …
sn54.5:2.11: you head upstream, going to the Akaniṭṭha realm …
sn54.5:2.12: When mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated in this way you can expect these seven fruits and benefits.”
